utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How can I help you this beautiful morning?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You got any cases?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Three. Got a teenage African-American lung transplant...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Next few days, you'll be doing nothing but clinic work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I just said...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You were lying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then why'd you ask?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Because if you told the truth, I was gonna give you only one day of clinic duty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's dishonest. In refuse to participate in this...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You'll do it. You owe me. I kept you out of jail, I can put you back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Perjurer.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Felon.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How can I help you this beautiful morning?

utterance.speaker: BASHFUL OLD LADY
utterance.content: I think I have a...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who is here for a runny nose?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a cold! It'll get better. Go home!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Those of you who have stayed obviously do not have colds.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'll be assigned a doctor, who is not me, 'cause I'm tired of wiping crotches.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House! You're doing this.

utterance.speaker: EAR GUY
utterance.content: It hurts!

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Sir...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Call security.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I'm good, thanks.

utterance.speaker: EAR GUY
utterance.content: Head on fire!!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Need a team here!

utterance.speaker: MARKO
utterance.content: I have the sedative!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Little late.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just in time.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What did you give him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Paralytic.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why would you do that?!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Somebody had to stop the screaming.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Then he's still in pain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah! But quietly.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Paralytic stopped him breathing. He goes hypoxic, he's gonna be quiet forever.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, either I can continue to swab people's privates, or I can figure out if this guy's delirium, pain and insanely high heart-rate are life-threatening or just a personality quirk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think the latter choice is better for all three of us.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's sedated. It took five cc's of haliperidol to get him down after the paralytic wore off.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, pain in his right ear, psychotic behaviour and dizziness. Go!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Nurses said he was holding his head. How d'you know it was specifically his ear?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because he was dizzy. Means the problem was affecting his inner ear.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nurses said he was running in circles. Doesn't mean he was dizzy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He wasn't running in circles. He was running in oblongs. Looked like a three-year-old kid drew them.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Acoustic Neuroma that started a haemorrhage.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Splains the pain, vertigo, everything. Get an MRI.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If it explains everything, what...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It might not explain everything.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What if he was psychotic first? Then self-mutilated, damaged the ear.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excellent. Need a complete psychiatric work-up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your turn.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Uhh, I was... gonna say what Foreman...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, say something else.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He... came to the clinic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Goood...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Decent chance he had a chronic illness first, 'specially given the rapid heart rate.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Lingering ear infection. Pressure builds up in his inner ear, bursts through the

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ohhh, yes! Get a head CT, draw a blood culture, run a chem panel and get a complete blood count.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, while you're at it, pour some alcohol into his ear and take out the cockroach.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He has a cockroach in his ear?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He was scratching that ear right before the event, so I took a peek. My guess is, it started biting.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nothing else wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wasn't that enough? Pretty gross.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So, why are we doing the tests?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, it's either that or I have to keep doing clinic duty. Do the tests or just stay out of Cuddy's sight, I don't really care which.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because it's not a hospital.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's a jogging park. You're not jogging. You can't jog.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Watching jogging. I sit, I watch, I imagine.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So... what do you watch for?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That guy's running in shorts.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He's not jogging, he's trolling.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're good at this.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: How long are you goin' to stay here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Beauty of this place is that it's the last place Cuddy will look.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: The doctors gave me this.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What doctors?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: At the other hospital. Last month.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Do you know what this is?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: "Patient has a six centimetre mass in the right lung. Cancerous. Inoperable." Do you understand what this means?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Is it okay if I sleep here tonight?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: It's cold outside.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What're you doing here? Thought House had a case.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He doesn't.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You ordered a CT on a patient with a bug in his ear?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How'd you know I was here?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Ran into Cameron in the clinic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: "Ran into"?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You ordered pointless tests just to...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't've been pointless if you didn't "run into" Cameron.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She got punished. She's stuck with another dying patient.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Is that Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Breath mint. Thought you were gonna kiss me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What happened to rehab?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got out.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It was a scam?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Enough foreplay. You gonna kiss me or not?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You are going back to the clinic. Or jail.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You perjured yourself to keep me out of jail. How're you...?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I only did that because I thought you were getting clean.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So it's do clinic duty or go to jail.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then it'll be finish your paperwork or go to jail. Help with fundraising or go to jail. Do your job or go to jail. I think I'd rather go to jail.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You owe me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bea-utiful.

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: Thank you. It's dry.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who cares. It's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If my lawn was half as well maintained as that, pigeons wouldn't have the nerve to poop on it.

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: Good grooming is important.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is that a shot?

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: People do judge you on your appearance.

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: When you entered, I noted your shirt hadn't been pressed; you hadn't shaved in quite some time.

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: I extrapolated you were a person for whom detail is not a major concern. I was worried you might apply the same standard in your work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You use toe-nail clippers up there?

utterance.speaker: SHERLOCK NOSE
utterance.content: They're longer, so they allow me to better reach the upper hairs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am wearing a rumpled shirt, and I forgot to brush my hair this week. You've got athlete's foot in your nose.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm ready to be judged.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay! Fifty dollars...!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...to any patient who's willing to leave here right now.

utterance.speaker: DAD
utterance.content: Get your stuff.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House! You can't...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My money.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't care. People do not...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They leave, fifty bucks. They're not all that sick.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Or they're poor.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: And desperate. Which was why this place is here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If they're that poor, then they'd rather have fifty bucks.

utterance.speaker: OLD GUY
utterance.content: Can I have the money?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look. It's monogrammed. He doesn't need money. Ergo, he's not sick.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: And the blood?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Could be anybody's. Monogram's definitely his.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't matter what you say, do or threaten. I will find a way out.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How can we make this more interesting for you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How can we make the sky green? How can we make the tall short? You cannot make the uninteresting interesting.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'll pay you ten dollars for every patient you diagnose without touching.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You pay me ten dollars for every one you have to touch.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're making this into a game for me. From which I can only conclude this isn't a game for you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why? Think if I deal with enough people, I'll find some humanity?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: TONGUE GUY
utterance.content: Wha' ah ha' todo 'is mahsulf?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got a bum leg. Say "Aah".

utterance.speaker: TONGUE GUY
utterance.content: Aaahhh-aahh.

utterance.speaker: STOMACH LADY
utterance.content: Feels rough.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! It's a rash. Can't get any more than "rough".

utterance.speaker: STOMACH LADY
utterance.content: Well, it's just rough. Can't you feel it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, I could. But then, what satisfaction would you get?

utterance.speaker: PULSE DUDE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Start counting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How many?

utterance.speaker: PULSE DUDE
utterance.content: T-twenty six.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay. Either you suck at math, or you're gonna die in two seconds. You suck at math.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Diagnosis! Prescription! You owe me thirty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I owe you ten.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Test results are back for your STD patients. I'm not paying you for them. You already touched them.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How old are you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you've never seen an after-school special? Dawson's Creek? How do you get to thirty and not know about condoms?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. But you will. Every patient who comes in here for an STD test has one thing in common. They had SWS. "Sex While Stupid".

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How old are you?

utterance.speaker: BASHFUL OLD LADY
utterance.content: Sixty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're lying. That's not the point. You've never seen Dawson's Creek?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you've never seen an after-school special? How do you get to your age and not know about condoms?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I have an STD?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah! You're actually the first one today. Lucky day. Not for you, but gotta feel good for everyone else.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's Chlamydia. As bad news goes, 's about the best.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, settle down. It's treatable. It's actually curable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: All you have to do is take these pills...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: DON'T TOUCH ME!!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I need someone to cover a patient.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House, you're committed to...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She was raped. Think I'm the right doctor for her?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: We've assigned another doctor to your care.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I didn't mean to upset Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He knows that. That's not why we're doing this.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'd like to keep being treated by him.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: W-Why?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Just do.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Trust me, it's better if you deal with somebody who specialises...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You told Dr. House it's been less than a week. You haven't told anyone other than him. Emotionally, you're still...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You know what I'm dealing with? You know what I'm going through?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No. You think Dr. House does? I'm not suggesting either one of us be your doctor. Dr. Stone is psychiatri...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: If Dr. House is too busy, I could wait.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why do you want me?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't wanna treat you.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're just saying that so I'll see the psychiatrist.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: True. 'Cept for the word "just". I'm saying, I don't wanna treat you so you'll see the psychiatrist and because I don't wanna treat you.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Why don't you wanna treat me anymore?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I never wanted to treat you. Fact that you were raped holds no interest for me. It's nothing personal. There's nothing to treat. You're physically healthy.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: But I want you to be my doctor.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You gotta have a reason. Everything has a reason.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I trust you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah, see, that's a bad reason. 'Cause I'll lie to you. I'll tell you anything just to get you out of here.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't care. I wanna talk to you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look, you were raped. All control was taken away from you. You're trying to find that control again. You want me because I don't want you.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'm raping you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: In a very non-invasive, more annoying than trauma...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Get the hell out of here!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll send in Dr. Stone.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I didn't consent to all this medicine.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You've been out on the streets. No treatment...

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I'm dying, there's no treatment for dying.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: We can make you comfortable.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Don't wanna be.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Because I screwed up my life.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So you wanna punish yourself for messing up your life?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Please, stop the treatment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It'll go away on it's own.

utterance.speaker: HICCUP GUY
utterance.content: It's not can...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, it'll go away.

utterance.speaker: HICCUP GUY
utterance.content: It's been all day. There must be some treatment you...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope! It'll go away.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or... it won't go away.

utterance.speaker: HICCUP GUY
utterance.content: I read about a treatment.

utterance.speaker: HICCUP GUY
utterance.content: Some guy won a prize for it.

utterance.speaker: HICCUP GUY
utterance.content: I read about it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't have the hiccups, do you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Make a note. Drug-seeking behaviour.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Morphine?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No! Anal-digital stimulation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How long has Stone been in with her?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Are you concerned?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know how many people get raped everyday?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So it's common, therefore boring.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We were to care for every person suffering on the planet, life would shut down.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How 'bout just the ones we meet?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They deserve our sympathy more than the other people?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So your solution is not to give a damn about any of them? How do you do that? How do you take that theory

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hey! Whoa!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! I paid these people fifty bucks to leave here an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then you owe fifty.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: The kid needs surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And he could walk way back then. Stand up, kid.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: He swallowed a magnet. We gotta cut it out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How old are you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And he swallowed something stuck to a fridge? Darwin says let him die.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's already below the stomach. It should pass on its own.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Strong magnet. It's messing with the imaging. We have no way to...

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Got X-ray vision, House?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's well into the intestines. He's fine. I want my fifty back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Breastplate sounds shallow.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did you say to her?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Heartbeat's irregular!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did she say to you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You must have said something.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You gonna do that again?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're gonna be okay... physically.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Which is all that interests you.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Under orders.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Why would you tell me that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Cause I don't like hypocrisy.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: But you don't have a problem with cruelty?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which brings us back to, why do you want me?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tried to kill yourself 'cause you couldn't talk to me. Must have a reason.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Why's there always have to be a reason? Can't we just talk?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's a phone. Talk to a friend. Family-member. Call the police.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You wanna talk about what happened to you?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Talk about your STD meds?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't really seem to wanna talk.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: No, I do.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Bout what?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't know. Anything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The weather?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You were raped and you want to talk about the weather?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not gonna talk to you about the weather.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'll help her!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She wants you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: God knows why.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She doesn't know what she wants.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She knows she wants you. You're the first person she spoke to about this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fact that I was in the wrong place at the wrong time, should be trumped by the fact that I'm useless at this.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No, you're not.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You romantically wanting to believe that is never gonna make it true.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm agreeing with you. You're the last person she should be talking to.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: She wants to talk about the weather, talk about the weather. She wants normalcy. She wants to feel like the world didn't end.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right. I'll tell her that everything went on without her. Babies were born, people got married. Thousands of people will remember the day she got raped as the happiest day of their lives.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You might not wanna phrase it quite that way.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You need to get her to talk about what happened.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, he doesn't.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Pretending it didn't happen...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wrong! Pretending this didn't happen is the best thing she could possibly do.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: She's gotta make this real.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You know what we should be trying to make real or process? The few decent moments in our lives, not the crap.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Maybe you're right! Except there's no way she can pretend this didn't happen, so she has no choice but to process it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You gotta tell me what happened.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You don't really wanna hear.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure I do.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't have to destroy your life.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't mean anything about you. Wasn't your fault.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You did nothing wrong. Some jerk hurt you, that's all.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're worried that you can never trust men again.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Statistically, there was always a chance this could happen. The fact that it did happen doesn't change anything. World doesn't suck anymore today than it did yesterday.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I know all that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then what do you want me to tell you?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Nothing. I just want to talk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: About nothing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We talk about nothing, nothing will change.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: It might.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Time. Time changes everything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's what people say. It's not true. Doing things changes things. Not doing things,... leaves things exactly as they were.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why do you have to suffer?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I gave my word.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Who would make you promise that?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: My father. He said I would die alone and miserable.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: That's not a promise. And even if it was, he's dead and even if he's not, he's not gonna care.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Why did your husband have to suffer?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: How do you about my husband?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Well, I just know.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You have to die in pain because of a promise you made to your father?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: If I'd say "yes", you'd use that as proof that I'm insane. Force treatment on me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Did the nurse tell you about my husband?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Nurse!

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's under control.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I was just trying to freak you out.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Because I need you to remember me. I need somebody to remember me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where'd you go to college?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Northwestern. You?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hopkins. What was your major?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Comparative religion.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why do you trust me?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't know. Can't we just talk...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's not rational!

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Nothing's rational.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everything is rational!

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I was raped. Explain how that makes sense to you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We are selfish, base animals, crawling across the earth. But 'cause we got brains, if we try real hard, we can occasionally aspire to something that is less than pure evil.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Has anything terrible ever happened to you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What do you want me to say?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You wanted this conversation. You wanted to talk about something that matters. Talk.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She's waiting for your answer?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's asleep. I sedated her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why do you care what you say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I don't know how to answer these questions.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It’s a simple question. Has your life sucked? Tell her the truth. Tell her you were shot. Tell her...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She doesn't wanna hear the truth. She's looking for something. Looking to extrapolate something...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She's looking to connect with you, and that's what's scaring the hell out of you. Tell her the truth.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There is no truth.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are we role-playing? Am I you? I don't wanna be you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's not asking for test results. She's not asking what two plus two equals. She's asking for my personal life experience, so she can extrapolate the law of humanity. That's not truth, that's bad science.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's not science at all. Tell her the truth.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Tell her your life has been good.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It hasn't been.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Tell her anyway. She wants hope, she wants to know that what happened to her wasn't the norm. Things can be okay, which means maybe they can be okay for her again.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tell her your life sucked.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It didn't.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tell her anyway. She wants to know she's not alone. She wants to know she's gonna survive this thing. Other people have been through this and worse, and come out the other end. She wants to know she's going to heal.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Act like... you've healed.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Tell her... Keep her asleep.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thanks, you've all been a huge help.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's no wrong answer. Because there's no right answer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wrong. We just don't know what the right answer is.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wake up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'S not bad as what happened to you, I don't think. I don't know what happened to you. And given how lousy you're responding, I assumed it was worse than getting abused by your grandmother.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: What did she do to you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Parents travelled a lot, leaving me with her. She liked things the way she liked them. She believed in discipline. She was right, I suppose. I hardly ever screwed up when she was around. Too scared of... being forced to sleep in the yard or take a bath in ice. Your turn.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Your parents, they-they never stopped her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Never told them.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Usual reasons. I was afraid they wouldn't believe me and I was afraid they'd think I' done something wrong. I opened up to you, you open up to me.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: What did you call her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oma.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: And you kept calling her that after this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dutch for "grandmother". She's still my grandmother. And she was still Dutch.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Is any part of that story true?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: All of it.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You wouldn't keep calling her "Oma". Something would have to change.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't know me.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You wouldn't keep calling her "Oma"!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look, you're overreacting.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Do not dismiss me!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not dismissing you. Saying you're not acting rationally.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'm angry because you're lying to me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. You're...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: What can I do? What the hell can I do that you're not gonna dismiss as just being because I was raped?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Your story. Is it true?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: True for somebody.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: But not for you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: These things happen. Happened to somebody. What do you care if it happened to me?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: They're not in this room.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No! They're out there! Doctors, lawyers,... postal workers! Some of them doing great, some of them doing lousy! You're gonna base your whole life on who you got stuck in a room with?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'm gonna base this moment on who I'm stuck in a room with. It's what life is. It's a series of rooms. And who we get stuck in those rooms with adds up to what our lives are.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You gotta get me out of this. There's nothing to diagnose. There's nothing...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You only tested her for STDs?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I had seven morons who forgot their raincoats. 'S all they asked for, so I didn't waste the lab's time. Why?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I wasted their time. She's pregnant.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You understand? You okay? I know you're not okay. Are you more or less not okay than you were five minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: About the same.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Termination procedure is unpleasant.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't wanna terminate.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You wanna keep the baby?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Abortion is murder.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: True. It's a life. And you should end it.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Every life is sacred.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Talk to me, don't quote me bumper stickers.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: It's true.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's meaningless.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: It means every life matters to God.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not to me, not to you. Judging by the number of natural disasters, not to God either.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're just being argumentative.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah! I do do that. What about Hitler? Is his life sacred to God? Father of your child? Is his life sacred to you?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: My child isn't Hitler.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Either every life is sacred or...

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Stop it! I don't wanna chat about philosophy!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not killing your rape baby because of a philosophy.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: It's murder! I'm against it. You for it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not as a general rule.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Just for unborn children?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! The problem with exceptions to rules is the line drawn. Might makes sense for us to kill the ass that did this to you. But where do we draw the line? Which asses do we get to kill? Which asses get to keep on being asses? Nice thing about the abortion debate is we can quibble over trimesters, but ultimately there's an ice-cold line - birth. Morally, there isn't a lot of difference. Practically, huge.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're enjoying this conversation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This is the type of conversation I do well.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: But the other type? The personal stuff?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There are no answers.If there are no answers, why talk about it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're healthy. You shouldn't be here.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't wanna go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine. I won't discharge you. Wanna go for a walk?

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: The last of my journey.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You don't deserve pain. You're just an insane, old man.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: No. No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'm not gonna watch you suffer.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I need you to remember me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'll remember you!

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Because you're a nice man.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: You don't know that. You don't know anything about me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Either you're a nice man or you're an ass. Either way you did something to somebody that they're gonna remember.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: I have no family, I have no friends. I didn't even have a real job. If I die in peace, then I'm just another patient. But if I die suffering...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It'll be horrible. Don't do that to either of us.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS OLD GUY
utterance.content: No! I just need to die, knowing that something is different because I was here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Life goes on.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Is that the reason we're out here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Know why I come here? I sit, I watch, I imagine.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Sounds nice.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Imagine if one of them would break a leg.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just one false step. One crack in the sidewalk.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You don't really.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm evil.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Evil people don't say they're evil.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sounds like an easy loophole. People can do good things, but their instincts are not good. Either God doesn't exist or he's unimaginably cruel.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't believe that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What do you believe? Why do you think this happened?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I don't wanna talk about it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Me neither. Too bad.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't think there was a reason!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Huh-huh. So God does exist, 'less you get raped. Easier to keep your rape baby for no reason.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Maybe he was challenging me!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He hurts you to help you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I guess it's better than he hates you.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You're trying to convince me there's no God! Why would you even say something like that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because you're throwing your life away.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'm doing what I believe!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What you believe doesn't make sense.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: This is not helping me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then I can't help you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you believe in eternity, then... life is irrelevant. Same way that a bug is irrelevant in comparison to the universe.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: If you don't believe in eternity, then what you do here is irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your actions here are all that matters.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Then nothing matters. There's no ultimate consequences. I couldn't live with that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So you need to think that the guy that did this to you is gonna be punished.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I need to know that it all means something. I need that comfort.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. You feeling comfortable? Feeling good right now? Feeling warm inside?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I was raped. What's your excuse?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Do you think the guy who did this to me feels bad?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That'll help you? Make you feel better?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Why do you always do that? Ask why I'm asking a question, instead of just answering the question.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The answer doesn't interest me. I don't care what he's feeling. I'm interested in what you're feeling.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: You are?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm trapped in a room with you, right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why did you choose me?

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: There's something about you. 'S like you're hurt too.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It was true.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: What was?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wasn't my grandmother, but it was true.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: Who was it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's my dad.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: I'd like to tell you what happened to me now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd like to hear it.

utterance.speaker: EVE
utterance.content: It was a friend's birthday party...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She terminated it. She's been discharged.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, it's that simple.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: She's talking about what happened. That's huge. You did good.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everyone will tell you... that that's what we gotta make her do. We have to help her, right? Except we can't. We drag out her story. Tell each other that it'll help her heal. Feel real good about ourselves. But all we've done is make a girl cry.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Then why did you...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I don't know.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You gonna follow up with her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: One day, one room.
